intro: Fusifilum gracile, commonly known as the slender filum, is a rare and delicate plant species belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated fronds that exhibit a delicate, feathery appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its reproductive structures are small and inconspicuous, consisting of sporangia clustered on the underside of the fronds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Fusifilum gracile is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
